chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan T Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Waukesha County Case 15CF505.

miscConds.notes: Restitution ordered in the amount of $46.28.  Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Defendant to comply with Sober Living at the Roots Halfway House.
No contact with the Pick N Save listed in the Criminal Complaint.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Cases 16CM779 and 16CF213 were dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt:
Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nathan T Boyd in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement: 1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
STAYED.
 
IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term or Probation:  3 Years.
Concurrent to:  Waukesha County Case:  15CF505
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Defendant to comply with his Sober Living at the Roots Halfway House.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Pick'N'Save listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Health evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Restitution:  $46.28 to be paid to Roundy's - to be paid before costs.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives (already provided).
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Defense request expunction.
Court Denies the defense request for expunction.
